question: The agreement to establish African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA), which was seen in the news, was signed in which year?
explanation:
The Agreement establishing an African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) was signed in 2018, in Kigali, Rwanda.
The AfCFTA is expected to become operational on 1 January 2021, which will be the worldâ€™s largest free trade area by number of countries. It will also create a single African market for goods and services. Africa Industrialization Day is celebrated on November 20 every year.
